The name of this welfare scheme is 25% Capital Investment Subsidy Scheme. It is also known as 25%CISS. Introduction:
The Union Territory of Lakshadweep has been declared as the “No industrial Area” and hence no scope for establishing major Industries in this UT. The Govt. of India is giving significant emphasis on setting up Small-Scale Industrial units for the economic development of the Islands in order to create self-employment/ job opportunities considering the lack of employment in the Government Sector under the U.T. Administration. Specific studies were conducted by the Planning Commission in pursuance of the decision taken by the Standing Committee of the Island Development Authority and constituted an Expert Committee. The Committee learned about problems of Industrialization in these Islands and identified special needs that would accelerate the Start-up Industries in Lakshadweep. Based on the recommendation of the expert committee, Govt. of India has approved the implementation of a scheme called 25% Capital Investment Subsidy to the local entrepreneurs for promoting Micro and Small Enterprises in Lakshadweep. This scheme paves the way to improve industrialization and to facilitate local entrepreneurs/unemployed youth to take up viable ventures (Micro &amp; Small Enterprises) in the Islands.
Objective of the Scheme:
•	To promote Micro &amp; Small Enterprises.
•	To generate employment opportunities in the private sector.
•	Industrial Promotion &amp; Economic Development of the islands. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Lakshadweep. The implementing agency is Department Of Industries, Kavaratti. Additionally, the nodal department is Industries Department, Lakshadweep.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Under the scheme, financial assistance of 25 % of the total cost of the Enterprise inclusive of land, machinery, and construction limited to the maximum amount of ₹25 lakhs will be provided to the eligible entrepreneurs.

Eligibility criteria include: Any individual above 18 years of age including Women, exservicemen &amp; physically handicapped is eligible to apply under the scheme.
   New Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing/servicing except the activities specified in the Negative List are eligible to claim a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy established in Lakshadweep Islands.   Micro Enterprises/Units, where the investment in Plant &amp; Machinery and Building below ₹00 Lakhs is only eligible under this Scheme.
   The Entrepreneurs Memorandum PartII (Permanent Registration) under the MSME Act 2006 filed before the Director of Industries, U.T. of Lakshadweep or Udyog Aadhar registration/otherwise shall be eligible for availing subsidy under this scheme as per AnnexureI.   Institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act 1960 and SelfHelp Groups that have not availed financial benefits under any other scheme are eligible for a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy.

Note: The area of operation of the scheme is in all inhabitant islands of Lakshadweep.
Negative List of Activities:
The following list of activities will not be permitted under 25% Capital Investment Subsidy Programmes/ Projects/Units.

The name of this welfare scheme is 25% Capital Investment Subsidy Scheme. It is also known as 25%CISS. Introduction:
The Union Territory of Lakshadweep has been declared as the “No industrial Area” and hence no scope for establishing major Industries in this UT. The Govt. of India is giving significant emphasis on setting up Small-Scale Industrial units for the economic development of the Islands in order to create self-employment/ job opportunities considering the lack of employment in the Government Sector under the U.T. Administration. Specific studies were conducted by the Planning Commission in pursuance of the decision taken by the Standing Committee of the Island Development Authority and constituted an Expert Committee. The Committee learned about problems of Industrialization in these Islands and identified special needs that would accelerate the Start-up Industries in Lakshadweep. Based on the recommendation of the expert committee, Govt. of India has approved the implementation of a scheme called 25% Capital Investment Subsidy to the local entrepreneurs for promoting Micro and Small Enterprises in Lakshadweep. This scheme paves the way to improve industrialization and to facilitate local entrepreneurs/unemployed youth to take up viable ventures (Micro &amp; Small Enterprises) in the Islands.
Objective of the Scheme:
•	To promote Micro &amp; Small Enterprises.
•	To generate employment opportunities in the private sector.
•	Industrial Promotion &amp; Economic Development of the islands. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Lakshadweep. The implementing agency is Department Of Industries, Kavaratti. Additionally, the nodal department is Industries Department, Lakshadweep.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Under the scheme, financial assistance of 25 % of the total cost of the Enterprise inclusive of land, machinery, and construction limited to the maximum amount of ₹25 lakhs will be provided to the eligible entrepreneurs.

Eligibility criteria include: Any individual above 18 years of age including Women, exservicemen &amp; physically handicapped is eligible to apply under the scheme.
   New Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing/servicing except the activities specified in the Negative List are eligible to claim a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy established in Lakshadweep Islands.   Micro Enterprises/Units, where the investment in Plant &amp; Machinery and Building below ₹00 Lakhs is only eligible under this Scheme.
   The Entrepreneurs Memorandum PartII (Permanent Registration) under the MSME Act 2006 filed before the Director of Industries, U.T. of Lakshadweep or Udyog Aadhar registration/otherwise shall be eligible for availing subsidy under this scheme as per AnnexureI.   Institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act 1960 and SelfHelp Groups that have not availed financial benefits under any other scheme are eligible for a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy.

Note: The area of operation of the scheme is in all inhabitant islands of Lakshadweep.

The following list of activities will not be permitted under 25% Capital Investment Subsidy Programmes/ Projects/Units.

sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is 25% Capital Investment Subsidy Scheme.
It is also known as 25%CISS.

Introduction:
The Union Territory of Lakshadweep has been declared as the “No industrial Area” and hence no scope for establishing major Industries in this UT.
The Govt.

of India is giving significant emphasis on setting up Small-Scale Industrial units for the economic development of the Islands in order to create self-employment/ job opportunities considering the lack of employment in the Government Sector under the U.T. Administration.
Specific studies were conducted by the Planning Commission in pursuance of the decision taken by the Standing Committee of the Island Development Authority and constituted an Expert Committee.
The Committee learned about problems of Industrialization in these Islands and identified special needs that would accelerate the Start-up Industries in Lakshadweep.
Based on the recommendation of the expert committee, Govt.
of India has approved the implementation of a scheme called 25% Capital Investment Subsidy to the local entrepreneurs for promoting Micro and Small Enterprises in Lakshadweep.
This scheme paves the way to improve industrialization and to facilitate local entrepreneurs/unemployed youth to take up viable ventures (Micro &amp; Small Enterprises) in the Islands.

Objective of the Scheme:
•	To promote Micro &amp; Small Enterprises.
•	To generate employment opportunities in the private sector.
•	Industrial Promotion &amp; Economic Development of the islands.
The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
It is specifically implemented in Lakshadweep.
The implementing agency is Department Of Industries, Kavaratti.
Additionally, the nodal department is Industries Department, Lakshadweep.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Under the scheme, financial assistance of 25 % of the total cost of the Enterprise inclusive of land, machinery, and construction limited to the maximum amount of ₹25 lakhs will be provided to the eligible entrepreneurs.
Eligibility criteria include: Any individual above 18 years of age including Women, exservicemen &amp; physically handicapped is eligible to apply under the scheme.

New Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing/servicing except the activities specified in the Negative List are eligible to claim a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy established in Lakshadweep Islands.
Micro Enterprises/Units, where the investment in Plant &amp; Machinery and Building below ₹00 Lakhs is only eligible under this Scheme.

The Entrepreneurs Memorandum PartII (Permanent Registration) under the MSME Act 2006 filed before the Director of Industries, U.T. of Lakshadweep or Udyog Aadhar registration/otherwise shall be eligible for availing subsidy under this scheme as per AnnexureI.   Institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act 1960 and SelfHelp Groups that have not availed financial benefits under any other scheme are eligible for a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy.
Note: The area of operation of the scheme is in all inhabitant islands of Lakshadweep.

Negative List of Activities:
The following list of activities will not be permitted under 25% Capital Investment Subsidy Programmes/ Projects/Units.
Any industry/business connected with the processing/preparing of intoxicated items like Beedi/Pan/Cigarette etc.

Manufacturing of Polythene carry bags of less than 20Microns thickness and manufacture of carry bags or containers made of recycled plastic for storing, carrying, dispensing, or packaging of foodstuff and any other items that cause environmental problems.
The application process is as follows: Step 01: The Scheme will be advertised/ published through the Panchayat Raj Institution and Lakshadweep website every year to attract more Entrepreneurs.

Step 02: Newly established Entrepreneurs shall submit their application form as per the guidelines issued by the Department of Industries to the concerned DCs/SDOs of respective islands along with all the supporting documents.
Step 03: The duly constituted Island level Committee under the Chairmanship of DCs/SDOs shall verify the claims submitted by the Entrepreneur and also physically inspect the Units.
The same may be forwarded to the Director, Industries in the prescribed format (AnnexureIV) with complete details including bills received from the Entrepreneur.

ctus.text: The welfare scheme known as 25% Capital Investment Subsidy Scheme, or 25%CISS, aims to support the economic development of the Union Territory of Lakshadweep. Due to the declaration of Lakshadweep as a "No industrial Area," the focus is on establishing Small-Scale Industrial units to create self-employment opportunities. Specific studies conducted by the Planning Commission identified the need to accelerate Start-up Industries in Lakshadweep. As a result, the Government of India approved the implementation of the 25% Capital Investment Subsidy scheme to promote Micro and Small Enterprises in the region. The objective of the scheme is to generate employment opportunities in the private sector and facilitate local entrepreneurs in setting up viable ventures in Lakshadweep.

The Industrial Promotion & Economic Development scheme in Lakshadweep targets individuals as beneficiaries and is implemented by the Department Of Industries, Kavaratti, with the nodal department being Industries Department, Lakshadweep. Eligible entrepreneurs can receive financial assistance of 25% of the total enterprise cost, up to a maximum of ₹25 lakhs, covering land, machinery, and construction. Individuals above 18 years, including women, ex-servicemen, and physically handicapped individuals, can apply for the scheme. New Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing or servicing, except for activities on the Negative List, can claim the 25% Capital Investment Subsidy in Lakshadweep. Only Micro Enterprises/Units with investments below ₹00 lakhs in Plant & Machinery and Building are eligible under this scheme. Institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act 1960 and Self-Help Groups that have not received financial benefits from other schemes can also avail of the 25% Capital Investment Subsidy.

The processing and manufacturing of items like Beedi, Pan, Cigarettes, Polythene carry bags under 20 Microns, and containers made of recycled plastic for food storage are industries causing environmental issues. The application process involves advertising the scheme annually through the Panchayat Raj Institution and Lakshadweep website to attract entrepreneurs. Newly established entrepreneurs must submit their application forms to the Department of Industries along with supporting documents. Island level committees chaired by DCs/SDOs verify claims and inspect units before forwarding details to the Director of Industries. District level scrutinizing committees then review the information and recommend subsidies to beneficiaries based on guidelines. For more information, refer to the official website and guidelines provided.

In line with the decision made by the Standing Committee of the Island Development Authority, specific studies were carried out by the Planning Commission, leading to the formation of an Expert Committee. This Committee addressed the challenges of Industrialization in Lakshadweep and identified the unique requirements to boost Start-up Industries in the region. As per the expert committee's recommendations, the Government of India has sanctioned the implementation of a scheme known as the 25% Capital Investment Subsidy to support local entrepreneurs in promoting Micro and Small Enterprises in Lakshadweep. This initiative aims to enhance industrialization and empower local entrepreneurs and unemployed youth to establish viable ventures in the Islands. The scheme's objectives include promoting Micro and Small Enterprises, creating job opportunities in the private sector, and fostering industrial promotion and economic development in the islands. Under this scheme, eligible entrepreneurs can receive financial assistance equivalent to 25% of the total enterprise cost, up to a maximum of ₹6.25 lakhs, covering expenses like land, machinery, and construction.

The Committee learned about problems of Industrialization in these Islands and identified special needs that would accelerate the Start-up Industries in Lakshadweep. Based on the recommendation of the expert committee, Govt. of India has approved the implementation of a scheme called 25% Capital Investment Subsidy to the local entrepreneurs for promoting Micro and Small Enterprises in Lakshadweep. The District Level Scrutinising Committee is chaired by the Secretary (Industries) with members including the Accounts Officer(1), DP, Superintending Engineer, LPWD, Director (Plg. & Stats), and Director of Industries. The District Level Committee (DLC) will review the information provided by the Island Level Committee and suggest the subsidy amount for the Beneficiary as per the guidelines.

A "New Industrial Unit" refers to any Micro or Small Industrial unit established in the islands with an investment not exceeding ₹25.00 Lakhs, covering the cost of building, plants, and machinery. To be eligible for subsidy benefits in this scheme, the unit must be registered under this Department/online Udyog Aadhaar portal of M/O MSME/otherwise. Expansion, modernization, and diversification investments are not eligible under this scheme. The definition of "Building" includes the actual price of the building/built-up areas required for industrial units, assessed/certified by the Competent Authority. "Plant & Machinery" encompasses the actual cost of machines, equipment, and tools, with transportation charges, erection cost, etc. considered for investment calculation, limited to the approved rate.

Only taxes paid bills are eligible for subsidy. A GST Number is not required for Plants and Machinery purchased before the introduction of GST in July 2017. The definition of Plant & Machinery includes the actual cost of machines, equipment, and tools, along with transportation charges and erection costs, limited to approved rates. Second-hand machinery purchased from any industrial unit cannot be considered for a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy. Individuals above 18 years of age, including Women, ex-servicemen, and physically handicapped, are eligible to apply under the scheme. New Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing/servicing, except those in the Negative List, can claim a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy in Lakshadweep Islands, with Micro Enterprises/Units eligible if the investment in Plant & Machinery and Building is below ₹25.00 Lakhs.

To be eligible for subsidy under this scheme, entities must file the Entrepreneurs Memorandum Part-II (Permanent Registration) under the MSME Act 2006 with the Director of Industries, U.T. of Lakshadweep or obtain Udyog Aadhar registration. Institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act 1960 and Self-Help Groups that have not received financial benefits from any other scheme can avail a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy. The scheme operates in all inhabited islands of Lakshadweep. Activities such as processing/preparing intoxicated items and manufacturing polythene carry bags of less than 20 Microns thickness are not permitted under the subsidy program. Eligibility criteria include individuals above 18 years of age, new Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing/servicing (excluding activities in the Negative List), Micro Enterprises/Units with investments below ₹25.00 Lakhs, and entities with specific registrations as mentioned.

prompts.ctu_text: A "New Industrial Unit" refers to any Micro or Small Industrial unit established in the islands with an investment not exceeding ₹25.00 Lakhs, covering the cost of building, plants, and machinery. To be eligible for subsidy benefits in this scheme, the unit must be registered under this Department/online Udyog Aadhaar portal of M/O MSME/otherwise. Expansion, modernization, and diversification investments are not eligible under this scheme. The definition of "Building" includes the actual price of the building/built-up areas required for industrial units, assessed/certified by the Competent Authority. "Plant & Machinery" encompasses the actual cost of machines, equipment, and tools, with transportation charges, erection cost, etc. considered for investment calculation, limited to the approved rate.

prompts.ctu_text: Only taxes paid bills are eligible for subsidy. A GST Number is not required for Plants and Machinery purchased before the introduction of GST in July 2017. The definition of Plant & Machinery includes the actual cost of machines, equipment, and tools, along with transportation charges and erection costs, limited to approved rates. Second-hand machinery purchased from any industrial unit cannot be considered for a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy. Individuals above 18 years of age, including Women, ex-servicemen, and physically handicapped, are eligible to apply under the scheme. New Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing/servicing, except those in the Negative List, can claim a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy in Lakshadweep Islands, with Micro Enterprises/Units eligible if the investment in Plant & Machinery and Building is below ₹25.00 Lakhs.

prompts.ctu_text: To be eligible for subsidy under this scheme, entities must file the Entrepreneurs Memorandum Part-II (Permanent Registration) under the MSME Act 2006 with the Director of Industries, U.T. of Lakshadweep or obtain Udyog Aadhar registration. Institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act 1960 and Self-Help Groups that have not received financial benefits from any other scheme can avail a 25% Capital Investment Subsidy. The scheme operates in all inhabited islands of Lakshadweep. Activities such as processing/preparing intoxicated items and manufacturing polythene carry bags of less than 20 Microns thickness are not permitted under the subsidy program. Eligibility criteria include individuals above 18 years of age, new Micro or Small units engaged in manufacturing/servicing (excluding activities in the Negative List), Micro Enterprises/Units with investments below ₹25.00 Lakhs, and entities with specific registrations as mentioned.
